definition: doing good deeds brings the greatest joy (idiom)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
with great virtue one can take charge of the world (idiom)
to accumulate merit/to do good/to give to charity/virtuous actions
to do good works/to be merciful
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
lit. when you drink water, think of its source (idiom); gratitude for blessings and their well-spring/Don't forget where your happiness come from./Be grateful for all your blessings!
living a simple life as one's ideal (idiom)
Confucian moral injunctions of fidelity/piety to one's parents, respect to one's older brother, loyalty to one's monarch, faith to one's male friends
to bring honor to one's ancestors and benefit future generations (idiom)
